channel.title: Mapping Redash groups with Azure AD groups
channel.description: Is it possible to Map AZ AD DL’s to Redash Groups? . I am able to configure SAML + Azure AD and created a group in Azure AD all the users that are part of that group can login to Redash and they all become part of default group in Redash. What I am looking for is something like, say I create two azure groups admin general all the users that are part of admin --> gets mapped to a admin group in Redash all the users that are part of general --> gets mapped to default group in Redash

item.title: Mapping Redash groups with Azure AD groups
item.dc:creator: mssatish
item.description:
Can someone please answer this question ?

Read full topic

item.title: Mapping Redash groups with Azure AD groups
item.dc:creator: rjn0910
item.description:
I too would love to hear more about that script @Amit-Hora.

for my setup, i have an on-prem AD server and i can use either ldaps or ADFS to authenticate users with redash. what I need to do is get a group membership of the user and assign them to the corresponding group in redash if it exists.

Read full topic

item.title: Mapping Redash groups with Azure AD groups
item.dc:creator: Amit-Hora
item.description:
Is it possible to Map AZ AD DL’s to Redash Groups? . I am able to configure SAML + Azure AD and created a group in Azure AD all the users that are part of that group can login to Redash and they all become part of default group in Redash.
What I am looking for is something like, say I create two azure groups
admin
general
all the users that are part of admin --> gets mapped to a admin group in Redash
all the users that are part of general --> gets mapped to default group in Redash

Read full topic
